New Records: Juan Soto hit his 39th home run of the season, and with it, he reached 100 RBIs for the third time in his career. He also broke Ragans' streak of 543 curveballs without giving up a home run on the pitch.
Key Match Events: Juan Soto hit a go-ahead two-run home run in the 11th inning, and Jazz Chisholm Jr. delivered the final blow with his first career walk-off hit.
Pre-Game Insights: There are no pre-game insights mentioned in the article.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone praised Soto's performance, saying 'Huge swing by Juan there. A little rope-a-dope. Got up off the mat and put one in the seats.' Soto also expressed relief after coming through with a big hit.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees overcame a late-inning deficit to beat the playoff-bound Royals and take the three-game series. The win gave the Yankees a 1.5-game lead in the American League East with 16 games remaining.
Others: Juan Soto was injured during the game, fouling a pitch off the top of his right foot, but he stayed in the game and came through with a big hit.
